Better time management: With more time available, people would be able to better plan and manage their time, leading to increased productivity and a more organized life.
Reduced stress: Lack of sleep would likely reduce stress levels, as sleep is often a major contributor to stress and anxiety.
Improved mental clarity: Without the need for sleep, people would have more time to think and process information, leading to improved mental clarity and cognitive function.
Increased creativity: More time to think and process information would lead to increased creativity and problem-solving skills.
Better physical health: Sleep is often linked to physical health issues such as obesity, diabetes, and cardiovascular disease. Without the need for sleep, these health issues may be reduced.
